meanings.definition: To tear or pull at something in a rough or violent way.
meanings.sent1: The child was mammocking the paper, ripping it into small pieces.
meanings.sent2: She was mammocking the weeds out of the garden with determination.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was mammocking the squeaky toy, having a great time.
meanings.sent4: The storm was mammocking the trees, bending them with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was mammocking the playdough, squishing it between his fingers.

meanings.sent1: The friends were mammocking at the hilarious movie, unable to contain their laughter.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stop mammocking at the comedian's jokes during the show.
meanings.sent3: The baby started mammocking during the silly peek-a-boo game.
meanings.sent4: The students were mammocking in the classroom after hearing a funny story.
meanings.sent5: The family was mammocking around the dinner table, sharing jokes and laughter.
